alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 1:21PM AKST until December 17 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Strong winds and blowing snow with low visibility expected in west winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 1 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Strong winds could cause damage to buildings. Areas of blowing and drifting snow will cause reduced visibility with brief blizzard conditions possible. These strong winds will create wind chill values as low as 40 below zero which could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...West winds will increase this afternoon into tonight, with the strongest winds from late tonight through Friday afternoon. Winds are expected to decrease late Friday evening into the overnight hours.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.
